ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: If you have particular research interest in foreign policy, take this course and pursue it with a one-of-kind faculty member.
Great course. Amazing opportunity to interact with a distinguished practitioner and learn from his manifold experiences. Each class focuses on a different world issue.
Yes, one of the best classes I have ever taken.

Highly recommended for anyone interested in global diplomacy, regardless of current level of expertise. Real world context complementing theoretical academic study from other courses. Great professor, high level discussion, very interesting material. There is a lot of reading but only 2 papers that are relatively straightforward to write.
Weekly summary of different issues or countries - best class I took at Yale

This is survey class of current affairs and news from the American perspective with Ambassador Negroponte. You look at U.S. relations with varying regions of the world and discuss national security issues as they relate to the United States.
Yes I would recommend it. it hits up all the main topics in us foreign policy.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: This course 100% relates to my career as senior US Army officer because I work directly on US foreign policy through the military lens.
What better way to learn about a profession than to learn from someone who practiced it successfully at the highest levels of government?
First course I took in this area and found it incredibly fascinating and enlightening.
it hits up all the main topics in us foreign policy in a short time - good for understanding broadly.
